data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

When you face forward, your body is always facing forward. After taking 9 steps left, you are 20 steps away from starting point. If you take 9 steps right, you are 2 steps back from starting point. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The directions are the same except the directions are different. It is possible to return to the starting point by turning around and walking around. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The directions are essentially the same. After 4 steps you will turn around, take 10 steps to get back to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn left at the end of the way. Make sure the number is 4 - 1, then take 5 steps. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You take 9 steps to turn left, and there are 9 steps to get back to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you return to the starting point, you make a 1 in 14 mile loop around the circle and then back to when you began. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Just like the last instruction says you’re moving right. So, the answer is no.

In 1 second, you are 6 steps away from your starting point. In 2 seconds, you are 8 steps away from your starting point. Thus, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You always face forward. The next right step is taken. The next step is taken. The step that is taken is one of every 6 steps forward. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Take 3 Steps, go to the starting point. Take 9 Steps ( Turn the corner 1st) Go to your walking starting point. Take 2 Steps ( Turn the corner first) Go to your walking starting point and take 2 steps. Take 7 Steps ( Turn the corner first) Go to your walking starting point and take 7 steps. Take 3 Steps ( Turn the corner first)

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Taking 1 backward takes 1 step backward. To take 3 forward steps forward is not the same as taking 3 steps backward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
One must always face forward in order to return. One also has to take 7 steps right and 8 steps left if one wishes to return to the starting point. Thus, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The directions are repeated until you turn to the right and make a circle. They are repeated from left to right. The following are the steps taken until you make a circle: Take 9 steps left, take 10 steps left, take 3 steps left, take 1 step left, take 6 steps left, take 3 steps forward, take 4 steps right. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The second order is always the same. One is never going back. If you walk backwards one time, you will walk back. They are the same process. So, the answer is no.

The forward-facing person always takes 3 steps right towards the starting point. The reverse-facing person always takes 6 steps left. There are 4 steps forward from the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn right 5 times. Do the same for the direction you are turning back, then return to the start point. So, the answer is Yes.

Take 6 steps, and turn around, and take 9 steps to return to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

The first two instructions take 7 steps. The second one takes 9 steps. If you only take 7 steps, you should turn around again and turn right. So, the answer is yes.

Just because you know it' s not necessary is a big no. If people are already there, they will walk back in the direction they walked in and turn around. They turn around and then takes one step and again, takes two steps and then takes 9 steps. So, the answer is yes.

If you take a step that return to the starting point, it is a positive number such as 1. If you take 1 step that go back to the starting point it is a negative number such as 0. So, the answer is yes.

If you take 4 steps, you could return to the starting point. If you take 3 steps, you could return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow the instructions correctly, they are all the way to the starting point and you will return to that starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

The starting point is the place where you began taking steps. The first 7 steps are the first 3 steps back to where you started to. So, the answer is Yes.

Each step takes you forward in either direction you are facing upwards or in the backward direction. If you are facing downwards, you take two steps right followed by five steps backwards. The final answer: Yes.

This is the only way to return to the starting point. To work out the rest of the rules, you have to repeat the process with one of your own hands. The following can only be taken with your own hands. So, the answer is No.

Turn around and take 4 steps is the same as turn around and take 4 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

Walking backwards only results in a movement to the direction of travel. Walking reversely makes returning to start point inevitable. So, the answer is no.

Turning right and taking 5 steps turns you around. So, the answer is yes.

Keep facing forward. Once you are in front, you will always face forward. You usually take back one step from you starting point. So, the answer is no.

When you face forward you take 5 steps forward and 1 step backward. When you face right you take 4 steps right and 1 step backward. When you face left you take 8 steps left and 6 steps left. So, the answer is Yes.

Place one hand on the tip of your dominant hand (the one facing forward) and the other hand on the other hand. Make sure the hands are properly tied when you are facing forward. If your hands are not properly tied, you may slip or fall. To finish, take 1 step forward and 2 steps right. Make sure the hands are in one hand and the other hand does not. You returned 2 steps forward to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
